text:
“Do you remember that murder?” 

Raskolnikov's heart raced. 

“Porfiry’s old woman?” 

“Yes. The murderer has confessed. A painter, can you believe it?” 

Raskolnikov’s breath caught. 

“He disarmed suspicion, fought and laughed with his friends. Genius!” 

“From whom did you hear this?” 

“Porfiry, among others.” 

“Porfiry?” 

“Yes, he explained it all.” 

“What did he say?” 

Raskolnikov’s voice trembled. 

“Psychologically fascinating,” his friend replied, grinning. 

Raskolnikov felt the weight of his own secret.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** A murderer has been found and confessed to the crime, revealing his cunning and resourcefulness in evading suspicion.
